column4: hi, i use ubuntu. i can't ping my wifi printer from my laptop (my laptop is connected at the same wireless net). but i can ping the printer from my fixed hosts (fixed=with eth cable). is there anyone who has some idea?
can you ping the router?
yep
is the printer IP in the same subnet as the rest of the network?
yes
can you tracerote to the IP?
from what host?
ping
from the wireless system...
uh?
install traceroute from the repos and you can run:  traceroute ip.address.of.printer
traceroute to 192.168.1.50 (192.168.1.50), 30 hops max, 60 byte packets
please use a pastebin in furture
ok, however pina-laptop can't see the printer
could try setting a route to the IP manually, see if it helps some#
try: sudo route add -host 192.168.1.50 netmask 255.255.255.0 dev wlan0
assuming wlan0 is the wireless device
i will try
that tells the OS to use your wireless device to reach the printer
there is an error on the syntax
dang
http://www.ubuntugeek.com/howto-add-permanent-static-routes-in-ubuntu.html
